ygData.subject: Re: MM Drum misadventure and Nostrolo Tamborine
ygData.msgSnippet: I paid 5 pp for the foraged one (The guy said to give him whatever.. I felt like a cheapskate, but it was all the money I had in the world at the time.. I ll
ygData.messageBody:
I paid 5 pp for the foraged one (The guy said to give him whatever..
I felt like a cheapskate, but it was all the money I had in the world
at the time.. I'll probably find him and give him some more money at
some point) and 50 pp for the coin in Kaesora. The guy in Kaesora
was very helpful in telling me how difficult it would be to get the
coins and (from what he said) that specific coin was pretty rare, so
I felt it was worth more. The one's in Dalnir I got for free.

Prices could vary tremendously, I imagine, but remember that the
person you're dealing with can not complete the quest (unless they
are a Bard, have a Bard, or know a Bard). I always offer to pay in
my shout to the zone and then leave it up to the person who offers to
decide how much they want for it. Most people don't know what
they're for and are actually happy to give it away for free when you
tell them (MENTION THAT IT'S NO DROP!!!!). And most people would
have destroyed it anyway, so ANY money is more than they'd get
otherwise.

Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony


> Speaking of these coins, if you had to buy them, how much would you
expect
> to pay for them?
>
> Gilgurth
